attributes.action: Stop the D.F.E from passing anti-trans laws, in breach of the Equality Act 2010
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality Act 2010 Section 7
(2) A reference to a transsexual person is a reference to a person who has the PROTECTED characteristic of gender reassignment.

(3) In relation to the PROTECTED characteristic of gender reassignment—
   (a/b) a reference to a person(a) who has/share a particular PROTECTED characteristic(s) is a reference to a transsexual person

These are people you are meant to protect amongst others including Age.
You are breaking legislation and it needs to be changed.
attributes.background: Stop the Government, mainly the Department for Education from passing laws against the transgender/non-binary community. This is in breach of the Equality Act 2010.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about the Government's approach to transgender people, but we're not sure exactly what laws you're concerned about.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
